text.strong: ‌This school year, how often did you use the following <digital resources> at school?‌

text.em: ‌(Please select one response in each row.)‌
‌This resource is not available to me at school.‌

label.text: Desktop or laptop computer
Smartphone (i.e. mobile phone with Internet access)
<Tablet device> (e.g.<iPad®>, < Galaxy Tablet®>,) or <e-book reader> (e.g. <Amazon® Kindle™>, <Kobo®>)
Internet access (except on smartphones)
School portal (to consult timetable, absences, etc.)
Educational software, games or Apps, other learning tools (e.g. <CK-12™>, <Lucidchart>, or <Mathalicious®> online support)
A learning management system or school learning platform (e.g. <Blackboard®>, <Edmodo®>, <Moodle®>, <Google® Classroom™>)
<Virtual reality (VR) hardware> (e.g. <Google Cardboard®>, <Oculus>, <Class VR>)
Robotic devices (e.g. <3D printers>, <laser cutters>, <drones>)
<Artificial Intelligence (AI)> tools or software (e.g. <ChatGPT>, <MidJourney>, <Stable Diffusion>)
<National addition 600>

text.strong: ‌This school year, how often did you use the following <digital resources> outside of school (e.g., at home or where you usually access <digital resources>)?‌

text.em: ‌(Please select one response in each row.)‌
‌This resource is not available to me outside of school.‌

label.text: Desktop or laptop computer
Smartphone (i.e. mobile phone with Internet access)
<Tablet device> (e.g.<iPad®>, <Galaxy Tablet®>,) or <e-book reader> (e.g., <Amazon® Kindle™>, <Kobo®>)
Internet access (except on smartphones)
Educational software, games or Apps, other learning tools (e.g. <CK-12™>, <Lucidchart>, or <Mathalicious®> online support)
Video or online games (e.g. used with game consoles such as a < Play Station 5®> or <Nintendo Switch®>, online gaming platforms such as <Steam®> or gaming Apps such as <Candy Crush®>)
Smartwatch (e.g. <Apple Watch®>, <Samsung Galaxy Watch®> or fitness tracker (e.g. <FitBit®>)
<Virtual reality (VR)> hardware (e.g. <Google Cardboard®>, <Oculus>, <Class VR>)
Robotic devices (e.g. <3D printers>, <laser cutters>, <drones>)
<Artificial Intelligence (AI)> tools or software (e.g. <ChatGPT>, <MidJourney>, <Stable Diffusion>)
<National addition 601>

text.strong: ‌How long do you use the internet outside of school on a normal weekday?‌

text.em: ‌Please enter the time in hours and minutes. For example, if you use the Internet for 2 ½ hours per day, please enter 2 hours and 30 minutes.‌

label.text: hours
minutes
<hours and minutes per day>

text.strong: ‌How long do you use the internet outside of school on a normal weekend day?‌

text.em: ‌Please enter the time in hours and minutes. For example, if you use the Internet for 2 ½ hours per day, please enter 2 hours and 30 minutes.‌

label.text: hours
minutes
<hours and minutes per day>
The following question is about the availability, accessibility and quality of <digital resources> at your school.

text.strong: ‌To what extent do you agree or disagree with the following statements?‌

text.em: ‌(Please think of different kinds of <digital resources> such as desktop computers, laptops, smartphones and tablet devices as well as educational software and other digital learning tools.)‌
‌(Please select one response in each row.)‌

label.text: There are enough <digital resources> for every student at my school.
There are enough digital devices with access to the Internet at my school.
The school’s Internet is stable.
The school’s Internet speed is sufficient.
<Digital resources> function properly at my school.
<Digital resources> are easily accessible within the classroom.
Digital learning resources available at my school make learning interesting.
The school provides sufficient technical support to help students in their use of <digital resources>.
Teachers at my school have the necessary skills to use digital devices during instruction.
Teachers at my school are willing to use <digital resources> for teaching.
The following statements are about the use of <digital resources> for school-related activities in general (i.e. during lessons or when completing homework).

text.strong: ‌This school year, how often did you use <digital resources> for the following activities?‌

text.em: ‌(Please select one response in each row.)‌

label.text: Read or listen to feedback sent by my teachers regarding my work or academic results
Read or listen to feedback sent by other students on my work
Read or listen to feedback automatically selected for me by an educational software or App
Work on drill and practice exercises using an educational software or App
The following statements are about the use of <digital resources> for school-related activities outside of classroom hours.

text.strong: ‌This school year, how often did you use <digital resources> for the following activities?‌

text.em: ‌(Please select one response in each row.)‌

label.text: See my grades or results from specific assignments (e.g. homework or tests)
Browse the Internet for schoolwork (e.g. for preparing an essay or presentation)
Browse the Internet to follow up lessons (e.g. for finding explanations)
Receive or download assignments or instructions (via <digital resources>) from my teacher
Upload my work (e.g. documents or presentations) to a school portal or another platform to share materials with my teacher and/or students
Communicate with my teacher
Communicate with other students about schoolwork
Search for information on school-related activities or assignments

text.strong: ‌How often do you use <digital resources> for the following in your <school science> lessons or when completing homework?‌

text.em: ‌(Please select one response in each row.)‌

label.text: I use <digital resources> to collect data for experiments.
I use <digital resources> to interpret and analyse datagraph data.
I use <digital resources> to produce data visualisations (e.g. graphs, charts, diagrams)
I use <digital resources> to report the findings of experiments.
I use <digital resources> for simulations and modelling (e.g. <GeoGebra>, <NetLogo>), virtual laboratories (e.g. <Labster>).
I use <digital resources> for coding or algorithm activities (e.g. using <Scratch©>, <Python®> and <Java®>).

text.strong: ‌During a typical weekday, how much time do you spend doing the following leisure activities?‌

label.text: (Please select one response in each row.)

text.em: ‌More than 3 hours and up to 5 hours a day‌
‌More than 5 hours and up to 7 hours a day‌

label.text: Play video-games (using my smartphone, a gaming console or an online platform or Apps)
Browse social networks (e.g. <Instagram®>, <TikTok®>)
Browse the Internet (excluding social networks) for fun (e.g. reading news, listening to podcasts and music or watching videos)
Look for practical information online (e.g. find a place, book a train ticket, buy a product)
Communicate and share digital content on social networks or any communication platform (e.g. <TikTok®>, <Instagram®>, <Twitter®>, emails, chat)
Read, listen to or view informational materials to learn how to do something (e.g. tutorial, podcast)
Create or edit my own digital content (pictures, videos, music, computer programs)

text.strong: ‌During a typical weekend day, how much time do you spend doing the following leisure activities?‌

text.em: ‌(Please select one response in each row.)‌
‌More than 3 hours and up to 5 hours a day‌
‌More than 5 hours and up to 7 hours a day‌

label.text: Play video-games (using my smartphone, a gaming console or an online platform or Apps)
Browse social networks (e.g. <Instagram®>, <TikTok®>)
Browse the Internet (excluding social networks) for fun (e.g. reading news, listening to podcasts and music or watching videos)
Look for practical information online (e.g. find a place, book a train ticket, buy a product)
Communicate and share digital content on social networks or any communication platform (e.g. <TikTok®>, <Instagram®>, <Twitter®>, emails, chat)
Read, listen to or view informational materials to learn how to do something (e.g. tutorial, podcast)
Create or edit my own digital content (pictures, videos, music, computer programs)
The following statements are about your views on school rules regarding <digital resources>.

text.strong: ‌To what extent do you agree or disagree with the following statements?‌

text.em: ‌(Please select one response in each row.)‌

label.text: Students should not be allowed to bring mobile phones to class.
Students should not be allowed to bring their own laptop (or tablet device) to class.
Students should collaborate with teachers to decide on the rules regarding the use of digital devices during lessons.
The school should set up filters to prevent students from going on social media.
The school should set up filters to prevent students from playing games online.
Teachers should monitor what students do on their laptop or tablet device.
The next statements are about the quality, credibility and accuracy of information online.

text.strong: ‌To what extent do you agree or disagree with the following statements?‌

label.text: (Please select one response in each row.)
I trust what I read online.
When searching for information online I compare different sources.
I check the accuracy of online information before sharing it on social networks.
I discuss the accuracy of online information with my teachers or in class.
I discuss the accuracy of online information with friends or other students.
I discuss the accuracy of online information with my parents (or family).
I try to flag wrong information when I encounter it online.
I share made-up information on social networks without flagging its inaccuracy.
The following question is about your experience when browsing online content or using social media.

text.strong: ‌How upset were you the last time the following situations occurred?‌

text.em: ‌(Please select one response in each row.)‌

label.text: Encountering content online that was inappropriate for my age
Encountering discriminatory content online (e.g. about race, gender, sexual orientation or physical appearance)
Receiving unkind, vulgar or offending messages, comments or videos
Encountering unkind, vulgar or offending messages, comments or videos about someone I know
Information about me was publicly displayed online without my consent

text.strong: ‌To what extent do you agree or disagree with the following statements?‌

text.em: ‌(Please select one response in each row.)‌

label.text: I am interested in learning more about <digital resources>.
I am interested in learning <computer programming>.
I am interested in learning about <digital resources> because it could be useful in a job.
I like using <digital resources> to find new ways to do things.
I am interested in learning about <machine learning> and <artificial intelligence>.

text.strong: ‌Thinking about your experience with <digital resources>: to what extent do you disagree or agree with the following statements?‌

text.em: ‌(Please think of different kinds of digital devices such as desktop computers, portable laptops, notebooks, smartphones, tablet computers, cell phones without internet access, game consoles, or internet-connected television.)‌
‌(Please select one response in each row.)‌

label.text: I forget about time when I’m using digital devices.
The Internet is a great resource for obtaining information I am interested in (e.g., news, sports, dictionary).
It is very useful to have social networks on the Internet.
I am really excited discovering new digital devices or applications.
I really feel bad if no Internet connection is possible.
I like using digital devices.

text.strong: ‌Thinking about your experience with <digital resources>: to what extent do you disagree or agree with the following statements?‌

text.em: ‌(Please select one response in each row.)‌

label.text: To learn something new about digital devices, I like to talk about them with my friends.
I like to exchange solutions to problems with digital devices with others on the Internet.
I like to meet friends and play computer and video games with them.
I like to share information about digital devices with my friends.
I learn a lot about digital media by discussing with my friends and relatives.

text.strong: ‌What is the status of your Ceibal laptop at the moment?‌

label.text: I have not received a Ceibal laptop (Magallanes, Positivo, Chrome, etc.)
It runs smoothly
It works although something is broken
It is broken and does not work/is locked
I don’t know where it is/I lost it

text.strong: ‌Thinking about your experience with digital devices: To what extent do you agree or disagree with the following statements?‌

text.em: ‌(Think about the different types of digital devices, such as desktop computers, laptops, smartphones, tablets, mobile phones without an Internet connection, game consoles, or television connected to the Internet.)‌

label.text: I find the classes in which we use digital devices more interesting.
Teachers promote the use of digital devices in the classroom.
My school has clear rules about the use of digital devices or the Internet during classes.
In my school they talked to us about what to do when faced with episodes of violence or harassment on the internet or social networks.
At my school they talked to us about how to make safer use of the internet (e.g. privacy issues, viruses, etc.).
I have a cell phone that allows me to use the internet anywhere, even if I am not connected to WiFi.
Outside my school or home, I have to limit my use of the internet.

text.strong: ‌During the last 12 months, how often have the following situations happened to you in class?‌

text.em: ‌(Think about the different types of digital devices, such as desktop computers, laptops, smartphones, tablets, mobile phones without an Internet connection, game consoles, or television connected to the Internet.)‌

label.text: I was allowed to use the digital devices during a briefing or test
I was asked to turn off digital devices during the hours I am at the school.
A digital device was temporarily removed and later returned to me.
A digital device was temporarily taken away from me and a family member had to come and pick it up.
